title: The Path Through The Ocean
opening: After Roy captured Aquleia, other Etrurian powers slowly began to change their
views and express their anti Coup d'etat opinions.  Driven away from their
palace, Roartz and Arcard fled to Sacae, which was still under Bern's control.
Sacae is the vast plain-covered land in the center of the continent.  Before
Bern invaded, the various tribes there led nomadic lives.
The Etrurian army joined the Lycia Alliance Army to form a joint Etruria-Lycia
Union Army.  The decision was to head for Sacae to get rid of the remaining
Coup d'etat forces and also attack Bern, who was behind them.
Thinking that some Etrurian knight groups would not approve of being seen as
under the Lycia Alliance Army, Roy officially named the new Union the "Etrurian
Roy led the division responsible for entering Sacae.  The Sacae people are wary
of outsiders in the first place, but even worse, Brunnya, another of the Three
Dragon Lords, had gotten the largest tribe in Sacae, the Djute clan, under
submission.  The warriors of the Djute tribe and Brunnya's elite Bern troops
stood in front of Roy as he set foot on Sacae's soil.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: So... Narshen fell at Aquleia.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, General Brunnya. It has been confirmed.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: I see...

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: L-Lady Brunnya... What will become of us?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Please do not worry, Lord Roartz. You have assisted us, so we will not abandon you. I shall assure that.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: Thank you...

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Then, Lord Arcard, you will be assigned the defense of this land, Talas. Lord Roartz, your post will be the city of Bulgar.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: Talas!? W-Wait! This is too close to Aquleia. The enemy will be here in no time!

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Then all must do is defeat them. This is an ideal post to set up a defense. Since it is so close to Aquleia, the enemy will be sure to attack. We can be most prepared here.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: Well, that’s true...

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Bulgar...that is deep in the foreign lands of Sacae. I hear that there is much rebellion among the nomads...

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Then force them into submission. Is that not your specialty?

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Well...

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Rumors say that the enemy commander, Roy, is still a boy. Still, he has prevailed through many scandals and conspiracies to rebuild the Lycia Alliance Army and strengthen it further than ever. Compared to his hardships, yours are close to nothing. Am I wrong?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Then I must be off. I will be praying for your success.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: ...Are you sure, my lady?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Those two are disgraceful cowards who cast away their homeland to save their own skins. We must not assist them any more than necessary. They should be thankful that they are getting the land and troops that they are.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: We are soon approaching the Etrurian border.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Bishop Yoder, thank you for everything. Thanks to the Church, we were able to proceed thus far with ease.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Please. If you had not captured Aquleia, we would be suffering from persecution under Bern. This is nothing in comparison to what you did for us.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I am glad that I could be of use to you.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Now... May I ask you a very important favor?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes, anything that I am capable of.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: If you find out anything else about the Dragons...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I understand. If I discover anything new, I will report to you immediately.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Thank you! ...Ah, yes, I must tell you something else. The lands around here... They are surrounded by high mountains and valleys. And now that night has fallen...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The perfect setting for an ambush...

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Exactly. Castle Talas up ahead is under Bern’s control.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right. I will be careful.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Yes, please. Then, may Saint Elimine bless the Etrurian Army!

boss.speaker: Arcard
boss.line: W-Why! Why is this happening to me!?

boss.speaker: Arcard
boss.line: I...am an Etrurian...noble! I must not...die...here... Guh!

boss.speaker: Klein
boss.line: You are the one who betrayed Etruria, Lord Arcard!

boss.speaker: Arcard
boss.line: D-Douglas! You had turned to the enemy...!?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Arcard... What a pathetic ending for one who became so powerful.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Well, last year, I didn’t think we would be fighting in Sacae, either. Fate can turn out in the most unlikely ways... And that might be true for Bern as well.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: ...? Master Roy, what is it that you are holding in your hand?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh, this? This is the Fire Emblem.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Oh... So this tiny gem is...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess Guinevere wanted me to keep it. It seemed...difficult for her to give it to me... She must have been truly hoping to end the war peacefully until now...where this is no hope left...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hmm... Trust between siblings? It didn’t seem likely on the outside.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: The enemy is Zephiel, king of Bern! It is said that he murdered his own father, so I didn’t think that he would be moved by mere family relations...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What!? He killed his own father?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Didn’t you know, Master Roy? Zephiel took the throne because the former king had died. But because the former king’s death was so sudden, there are many rumors going around.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: She must know something about it, if not all.
